result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Mattison

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis Mattison in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Travis Mattison.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Franklin Officer S. Mueller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travis Mattison in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Travis Mattison.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Kuehn has been appointed.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travis Mattison in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  KTC

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Travis Mattison in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.   Abigail Doweiko, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/09/2022@2pm
